intro: Chlorocrepis tristis subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender violet, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. The subspecies gracilis is distinguished by its more slender growth habit compared to other subspecies of Chlorocrepis tristis.
